title: Software Development Engineer in Test
content:
Location: Flexible (Paris - Issy-les-Moulineaux) - This role is based in France with the flexibility to work from home.
GoPro delivers a set of world-class, cross platform, video editing applications on iOS, Android, MacOS and Windows that are collectively used by millions of people each month. These tools enable users to easily build incredible videos of their life events and share them with their family and friends. The Video Engine team provides the cross-platform engines that power each of the GoPro applications. Those tools assemble, filter and create video edits from a variety of user's media. Being part of this team means that you will be at the center of the action, working with artists to create the best video editing experience on mobile and desktop platforms.
 
The Role
This role will leverage the candidate’s software quality assurance and programming experience to help design, build, and run automated test tools.The Senior QA Engineer will be responsible for developing an end-to-end automated testing solution for the GoPro video rendering engine used in the QUIK mobile software.The Senior QA Engineer will work all departments and multiple locations to validate test coverage, execute automated tests, and help generate automated quality reports for company-wide visibility. The ideal candidate will be proficient in one or more programming languages and have experience in developing automated test tools in an agile software development environment.
Fluency in English is required. Please provide your CV in English. 
 
What You Will Do
Develop and automate testing solutions using Python 
Create pipelines from scratch using Jenkins
Test the video rendering engine on mobile devices to catch more bugs
Design and implement automated testing solutions from written requirements
Develop different types of automated tests (regression, integration, unit, performance, stress, image quality, etc)
Develop and maintain test applications on iOS and Android with mobile engineers
Use the Jenkins pipelines to automate test runs of applications on various mobile devices
Build detailed analysis and automated reports 
Collaborate with QA engineers, DevOps engineers, and Developers in Paris, Bucharest, San Diego
Help developers to reproduce bugs on devices for a complete investigation
Participate in release process on mobile platforms
Skills We’re Excited About
Experience programming in Python, C++, shell scripting
Experience with mobile development, testing, and debugging on iOS and Android (Swift, Java, Kotlin)
Strong skills in designing test frameworks on mobile devices
5+ years experience working in an agile software development environment
Knowledge of Jenkins Pipeline build jobs
Knowledge of digital video on mobile platforms
CI/CD best practices
Use of Git and Github
Self-motivated, good problem-solving skills 
Ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies and methodologies 
Collaborative mindset
ISTQB certification
Fluent in English, French is preferable. 
GoPro Highlights
Get your very own GoPro camera + gear
Excellent healthcare insurance coverage (Health-premium paid for 70% by GoPro)
Competitive salary and discretionary performance-related bonus
Subsidized lunch and snacks galore
Gym fee compensation
Transit benefit – 50% of the applicable public transportation pass
Flexible work arrangements
Discounted employee stock purchase plan
Professional + personal development opportunities, i.e. LinkedIn Learning, technology trainings, certifications, Peer-to-Peer learning, conferences and more.
Opportunities to get involved in the causes that you care about (annual camera donation + volunteer events) 
We strive for the day that no group can be described as underrepresented at GoPro – whether as part of our brand or in our workforce. We are committed to providing a more inclusive, representative, equal, just and happy world. GoPro is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
#SDET #QA # Automation #testing #flexible #LI-Hybrid #LI-ST1

questions.label: How did you hear about this job?

questions.description:
When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by a GoPro legal entity located in the EU (“Controller”). Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of (EU) 2016/679 General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.

Your personal data may be shared with a limited number of cloud services providers located in the USA and engaged by Controller, solely for the purposes of recruitment and hiring on Controllers behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the USA, your personal data may be transferred to the USA once you submit it through this site. Because the European Commission has determined that USA data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer, if any, will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under the GDPR. 

Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have to right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority. You can address any questions about your privacy by emailing to privacy@gopro.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
